thread.title: Shumlin: Health connect patch meets deadline - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-
thread.title_full: Shumlin: Health connect patch meets deadline - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: Kyle Midura
title: Shumlin: Health connect patch meets deadline - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-
text:
MONTPELIER, Vt. - Gov. Peter Shumlin says a substantial software upgrade to Vermont's health exchange met his self-imposed deadline Thursday.
The patch will be installed Thursday night as administrators take the website offline. They say when it boots back up Monday, the exchange should essentially be ready to automate re-enrollment, which begins in November.
Administrators say they may still need to make tweaks, but they have plenty of time to do so before November.
Setbacks have plagued the exchange since its launch two years ago.
Shumlin says Vermonters won't get a chance to test the new functionality until November, which he calls the real test.
"I want to make clear that today is not a mission accomplished. It's an update on extraordinarily optimistic-- that we're very optimistic that on November first this exchange is going to work as we all wished it would have," said Shumlin, D-Vermont.
Our Kyle Midura will have much more on this story tonight on the Channel 3 News at 6 p.m.
